rule-text: In French, nouns are either masculine or feminine.
explanation:
Feminine noun endings:
Most words ending in -e or -ion are feminine.
Exceptions: Words ending in -age, -ège, -é, or -isme are usually masculine.

Masculine noun endings:
Most nouns with endings other than -e or -ion are masculine.
examples:
Feminine:
"la table" (the table, ends in -e)
"la nation" (the nation, ends in -ion)

Masculine:
"le livre" (the book, does not end in -e or -ion)
"le fromage" (the cheese, ends in -age)
"le musée" (the museum, ends in -é)
